In that case, I would recommend 'Hush', directed by Mike Flanagan and starring Kate Siegel. 'Hush' is a psychological horror-thriller with home-invasion themes. I've attached a link to the movie's imdb page. Check it out and let me know what you think.
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5022702/

If you're looking for an older romantic movie with a bit more intensity, I recommend "Fear" (1996), starring Mark Wahlberg and Reese Witherspoon. It's a psychological thriller with romantic elements and explores themes of obsession. Find more about it on IMDb.
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0116287/?ref_=fn_al_tt_2

For a romantic movie night with more mature themes, you might enjoy "Boogie Nights" (1997), featuring Mark Wahlberg. It's a drama with romantic elements, exploring relationships in the adult film industry. You can find more details on IMDb.
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0118749/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_7_nm_1_q_boog

Given the nature of the movie, it might add a different flavor to your movie night. What are your thoughts on this suggestion for your movie date night with your husband? Let me know your feedback!

reference: A great superhero movie would be Marvel's The Avengers or the whole Avengers tetralogy. This movie emphasizes its heroes' humanity and a wealth of superpowered set pieces, it guarantees entertainment, fun and awe with the a fantastic gathering of superheroes. Here is a link for the movie: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/marvels_the_avengers

I recommend the Bollywood film "Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani" (2013). While it's not exclusively focused on Indian weddings, it includes vibrant and grand wedding sequences that capture the essence of Indian celebrations. The movie follows the journey of four friends through different stages of life, including weddings, and it offers a mix of romance, drama, and comedy.

It features beautiful wedding scenes, lively dance numbers, and explores the dynamics of friendships and relationships. "Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani" is known for its entertaining storytelling and visually appealing sequences, making it a great choice for a group of friends to enjoy together.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2178470/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_1_nm_0_q_Yeh%2520Jawaani%2520Hai%2520Deewani%2522%2520(2013)
preferences_for_each_session: the actress in 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani'

While Will Ferrell is more known for his comedic roles, he did take on a more action-oriented character in the film "Land of the Lost" (2009). It's a science fiction adventure-comedy where Ferrell's character, Dr. Rick Marshall, is transported to an alternate universe. Please note that this film is more of a comedic take on action-adventure rather than a traditional action movie.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0457400/

If you're specifically looking for Will Ferrell in action-comedy roles, "Land of the Lost" might be an interesting choice. However, it's important to keep in mind that Ferrell's filmography is primarily centered around comedy rather than action genres.
